intro: Echeandia oaxacana, commonly known as the Oaxaca spurge, is a flowering plant native to Mexico, specifically the state of Oaxaca. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with milky sap and showy flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small yellow flowers. It is often found in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
